Constants

TEST NOTE

test note: 1

SiriusTrack.Constants.electron_charge — Constant

Elementary charge of an electron: $e = 1.602176634e-19\ [C]$

source
SiriusTrack.Constants.electron_mass — Constant

Mass of an electron: $mₑ = 9.1093837015e-31\ [kg]$

source
SiriusTrack.Constants.electron_radius — Constant

Classical electron radius, also known as the Thomson scattering radius: $rₑ = 2.817940326204806e-15\ [m]$

source
SiriusTrack.Constants.electron_rest_energy — Constant

Rest energy of an electron: $E₀ = 8.187105776823886e-14\ [kg.m^2/s^2]$

source
SiriusTrack.Constants.electron_rest_energy_GeV — Constant

Rest energy of an electron in gigaelectronvolts (GeV): $E₀ = 0.0005109989499961642\ [GeV]$

source
SiriusTrack.Constants.electron_rest_energy_MeV — Constant

Rest energy of an electron in megaelectronvolts (MeV): $E₀ = 0.5109989499961641\ [MeV]$

source
SiriusTrack.Constants.electron_rest_energy_eV — Constant

Rest energy of an electron in electronvolts (eV): $E₀ = 510998.9499961642\ [eV]$

source
SiriusTrack.Constants.light_speed — Constant

Speed of light in vacuum: $c = 2.99792458e8\ [m/s]$

source
SiriusTrack.Constants.reduced_planck_constant — Constant

Reduced Planck constant, also known as h-bar: $ħ = 1.054571817e-34\ [J.s]$

source
SiriusTrack.Constants.vacuum_permeability — Constant

Vacuum permeability, also known as the magnetic constant: $μ₀ = 1.25663706212e-6\ [T.m/A]$

source
SiriusTrack.Constants.vacuum_permitticity — Constant

Vacuum permittivity, also known as the electric constant: $ε₀ = 8.854187812800385e-12\ [V.s/(A.m)]$

source
